intro: Torcula, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Torcula species are often found in Mediterranean regions and along the coasts of Europe and North Africa. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important component of coastal flora.
